After a couple of minutes of running, the two reached a clearing away from the academy and into a forest area. There the tired Chisame sat on the ground, leaning her body against a giant tree.

"Sensei, I hate to ask of you this, but do you happen to have food on you?", Chisame asked her teacher. "I didn't eat breaskfast this morning, and I'm worried that I won't be able to travel without some nourishment." To her surprise Negi had, indeed, food on him. Konoka made him a nice lunch for later the previous night, and the child teacher more than happily gave it to her student.

"Thanks", Chisame told her teacher as she quickly ate the food in only two bites.

"Do you feel better now, Chisame-san?"

"A little", she replied, now standing up. "It wasn't as much as I hoped, but at least I have energy again. Let's go!" Chisame then took Negi and plced him on her left shoulder, and the two decided to sneak back into Mahora Academy and to the library. But a 25-foot tall girl would cause much pandemonium in the school...Chisame would need a disguise. What should it be?
1333311.title: Tired and hungry giantess

choices: Chisame then feels herself tingling yet again
Chisame waits for her teacher to arrive with her things
13333112.content:
"Perhaps we can dress you for a prop or something?" wondered Negi outloud. "we could say that you're a prop for a school play."

"I suppose so", Chisame sighed while leaning against a tree, none too excited either way of her new predicament. "As long as I don't get bigger...AAH!" Chisame then felt her head banging up against a branch, noticing than she was higher up than previously, causing the usually reserved girl to worry a little.

"Oh great", Chisame groaned, now 30 feet tall. "I'm even a bigger freak than I was before! I hope you have a plan, sensei."

"I do", Negi smiled, and he ran back to the school as Chisame continued to stand under a tree, albeit in a lower position this time to not bump her head. All the while Chisame decided to take a nap, as she was tired from staying up all night on the Internet.

Negi soon enough arrived back to Chisame, showing off many a giant sheet, ones even big enough to cover Chisame, who in her sleep grew again, this time to 40 feet tall!

"If we put these on just right, we could say you're a statue or something", Negi explained to his student, who quickly put on the blankets over her body, thankful that she hadn't grown enough yet to the point where she couldn't put them on her without feeling small or tight. A few moments later Chisame had finished putting on the sheets, which were all the same color: blue.

"What AM I supposed to be?" Chisame asked her teacher, feeling silly in the blue blankets on her. She wished she had a mirror to see how ridiculous she was, walking around in blue sheets like a child wrapped around his blanket in a cold winter day.

"Well...you're SUPPOSED to be....well, I'm not quite sure", Negi nerviously told his student, who then slapped her forehead in frustration.

"Negi-sensei, grab my clothing utensils, make them grow, and come back here with them ASAP! I'll design my OWN costume!", Chisame said, nay, COMMANDED her teacher to do. Negi quickly ran as fast as his little legs could carry him back to his student's dorm.

"Guess I got to do everything myself", the glasses-wearing giantess sighed, growing yet another spurt, this time up to 50 feet. "This day is going to get more annoying before it gets better.."
13333112.title: Prop not proper

133331121.content: Chisame felt her body tingling yet again, covering her head with her hands in case she hit something from the growth. A few moments passed for the giantess, who closed her eyes during the process, before she was done changing size. When she then opened her eyes, Chisame noticed she was now..
133331121.title: Bigger idol, or little idol?

1333311211.content:
She was now 75 foot tall idol now! Negi sweated heavily as she stopped growing. Chisame glared a strong glare at him, scaring him even more than he already was.

"When are you going to find the cure for this!?" chisame asked as she nearly grabbed her teacher.

"Um..well.." Negi muttered.

As Negi was going to answer her question, they heard someone's voice. Both Chisame and Negi looked down to see who it were, and it was...
1333311211.title: Bigger idol, better view

choices: Chisame goes through with making new clothes
1333311212.content:
Chisame opened her eyes and saw herself covered in gigantic blankets. The girl spend minutes trying to get out, at first thinking she might have shrunk back to normal size. Whiler Chisame was definitely right in one way (she DID shrink), what she didn't know was how small she actually shrunk.

When Chisame finally got out, she wondered why the grass looked so tall next to her for a few seconds before coming to the conclusion that she shrank. The tree she previously banged her head on before looked postively gigantic now, taller than any building or tree she had previously seen in her life. Although glad her clothes shrank with her (even her glasses), Chisame was, unsurprisingly, unhappy. However, instead of cowering at her now bigger environment, Chisame was simply annoyed.

By this time Negi had finally come back with the supplies when he saw the blue sheets from earlier. The child teacher was confused as to why they were on the ground, and as Negi dug through them, he heard a thunderous "BOO!" from behind him, which caused to scream and fall on his butt. Seems that Chisame had hid herself in the curtains and scared Negi from behind him. Chisame snickered a little at Negi's fall, the first time she smiled all day since he gave her food earlier that morning.

"Chisame-san! You're...you're..." a gasping Negi blurted out. "You're so small!"

"Must be nice for you to not have to look upwards to talk to one of your students for once", sarcastically remarked Chisame. Negi was simply fascinated by his younger student's size, and he put his left hand next to Chisame's body, noticing that the girl was barely twice the size of his hand.

"You DO have my supplies, right?" asked Chisame to her teacher, stil lin a little bit of shock.

"Y-y-yeah", he replied, placing all of Chisame's sweing utensils and pieces of fabric on the ground. "So what are you going to do now?"

"Well, it might be difficult, but I'm going to try to make something that makes me look like a doll so we can get in without suspicion", Chisame explained to her teacher as she pounted her finger to her school uniform, already beginning to take out her supplies and make something. "Maybe a long-sized dress or some kind of casual clothing or something. I haven't decided yet."

"Are you sure you don't need help, Chisame-san?"

"Well....maybe a little", she shlyl blurted out. "I'm too small to cut anything properly, so you must be help me out and listen to EXACTLY what I say. Understand?"

"I do", Negi replied.
1333311212.title: Chibi-same

13333112122.content:
Despiteher teacher's generous help, Chisame came quickly to the conclusion that it would simply be faster for the girl to hide in something instead of make herself clothes, especially at her height.

"Actually, I've decided to forget the whole 'making clothes' idea", Chisame told her teacher. "Let's just go now to the underground library. Sound good?"

"It does", Negi replied in agreement. "But are you sure you'll be alright this small?"

"I'll be fine", an annoyed Chisame replied. "It's not like I haven't shrunk in height in the past. Remember when I was turned into a 7 year-old before?"

"I do. You were pretty cute", smile Negi, annoying Chisame greatly by his previous statement. She also look a little flustered by his comment.

"Anyway, we should go now before anyone finds out about this", Chisame said, walking to Mahora Academy as she told her teacher. But Negi noticed that she wasn't walking very far, so he picked his student up with his hands and placed the girl on his left shoulder.

"Sensei, I CAN walk, you know. It just takes me a while."

"Chisame-san, if we want to get there before night fall, it would make more sense for me to carry you", smiled Negi.

"Was that a height joke?" a sarcastic Chisame asked her teacher.
13333112122.title: Forget making clothes

133331121221.content:
Negi and Chisame killed time on the walk back by talking about what her net persona, Chui's next look would be. As Negi waited for a reply from a question he had asked her, he noticed that she was no longer in his line of vision.

"Chisame-san..." Negi said looking at his shoulder. He saw, or rather barely saw an even tinier Chisame standing on his shoulder. "Chisame you're-you're even smaller than before." He could see her jaw move in reply but heard no sound. "I can't hear you. Please talk louder." He saw her motioning something. She pointed to her head over and over. "You want me to poke your head?" Negi asked confused. After a quick smack to the face with her little hands Negi looked at her again. He realized she was pointing not at her head but at her ear. Negi offered his palm and she stepped on before he raised it to his own ear.

"Wow, sensei. For a teacher you're pretty stupid", came Chisame's voice ringing in his ear channel.

"Chisame-san this might be even worse than we thought", Negi said, worried.

"Oh? And how can anything be WORSE THAN THIS!!?" Chisame screamed.

"If this continues you'll shrink down to a subatomic level and continue shrinking until you're absorbed by an atom", Negi said putting his fore fingers together over and over again.

"WHAT!?! NEGI START RUNNING!!! We need to get to the library NOW!" Chisame shouted as Negi winced in pain.

"Right", he said as he began to sprint. They soon reached Library Island. Luckily, Chisame had remained the same size the entire time, but Negi was getting worried. They found Nodoka and Yue about to begin their decent into the massive building. Negi shouted to the two, "Yue-san! Nodoka-san! Wait up!" They turned around to see him running toward them.

"Negi-sensei?" they both said as he crashed into them.

"Omph! Sorry about that. It's just that, well we have a problem here", Negi said as he stood up, Chisame jumping onto his shoulder .

"You bet we do!" a barely audible voice yelled up at him. It was Yue, now about five centimeters tall, with a slightly luckier Nodoka, who was standing at about twelve centimeters, crouching next to her. The smallest of all three, Chisame, hopped down Negi's shoulder and down next to the other two.

"Oh no", Negi said with a groan. "It appears that I have the Midas touch. Only instead of gold, you all shrank!"

"There is nothing we can about that but to maybe get you some mittens", Yue said, speaking for Chisame.

"Well, the spell is already invoked, so I can still pick you guys up", he said as then all stepped onto his palm. "Now we have to go in and find a way to get you all back to normal." Negi walked into the opening with his friends on his shoulders. He comes to a forked pathway about twenty meters in. "Which way?" Negi asked his students, unsure themselves of whichway to go. Seeing two signs on the wall, Negi waked up to them and read them aloud. "The Hall of Magi and the Hall of Spells and Charms. Which way?"
133331121221.title: An Earful

1333311212212.content:
Negi decided to go to the path on the right, the one with spells and charms. After a few minutes of walking he walked into the brightly colored room. It had many glowing charms to the right side of it, as well as some spell books on the left. Negi quickly searched through the spell books looking for a reversal / growth spell / magic cancellation spell. He was quite surprised when he found one rather quickly! He then proceeded to look through the charms to see if any ward off magic or shrinking / growing spells, and he found the very charms that did so as well!

"Well, which one are you going to choose, Negi-sensei?" the tiny Nodoka asked of her teacher as she tugged on his left shirt sleeve.

"I'm thinking, I'm thinking!" a slightly aggravated Negi replied to his student's question. After a long pause to decide what to do, he decided to use...
1333311212212.title: Decisions, decisions

13333112122121.content:
Negi was flipping through the books at the rate of a mile a minute. Pages upon pages of the spell book were checked fully by his adrenaline widened eyes. He was pacing back and forth frantically as he read, making sure to get through every page of the writing so as to not mess his students' size up even more. When he found the page, he nodded to himself before setting his students down in front of him. Quickly he picked up a sharp rock and scratched a crude magic circle on the tile around them. After careful examination of the spell, he raised his staff and recited, "Refero Ad Normalis!"(Latin for 'Return to normal.')

Negi then watched as his students grew. Sweat drops of nervousness ran down his nervous face. To his delight, though, all three of his students returned to their exact sizes. He wiped what seemed like a gallon of sweat off his brow and, at the same time, touched Nodoka's shoulder.

"Oh no", he meekly said as the shrinking process began again. He quickly recited the same spell and Nodoka returned to her normal height.

"This is bad. Anyone I touch gets shrunk", he grimaced.

"Don't worry, sensei. There has to be a book here somewhere that can tell us how to remove a curse", Yue comforted Negi.

"You should be right, Yue-san. There are a lo~~t of books here." As Nodoka and Yue started to check out some books, one girl was heading towards the exit.

"Good luck finding the right one, sensei," Chisame unemotionally told her teacher as she walked out. Negi made no attempt to stop her, thinking he didn't deserve for anyone in the room to help him. Before leaving completely, though, Chisame stopped at the end of the door and turned around, asking her teacher "Well?"

"What do you mean?" a teary eyed Negi replied.

"I... I mean this is usually the time when someone says 'Don't go!' to the person that is leaving." Aggravated as ever, Chisame marched up to Negi and looked him straight in the eyes. "Grr... Fine I'll stay", she said.

"No, Chisame-san. You should go back to the dorms...in fact, all of you should. I can fix this by myself", Negi explained to his student. It fell on deaf ears, though, as all three girls ignored him at that point as they searched through different tomes, volumes of spells, and different colored charms for a solution.

"Negi-sensei! Negi-sensei! I found something", Nodoka said, reading excitedly.

"What is it?" the other three blurted out.

"It says that the place that we should have gone to fix all of us was not here. But the Hall of Magi!" Nodoka told the trio.

"Really?" Negi asked. "Why there?"

"It says that there's a strange aura emitted there. And it goes on to say that anyone with a pure heart and great desire for good shall enter said aura unscathed."

"'Unscathed'. What does it mean by that, I wonder? Whatever. It's getting quite late and we have school tomorrow. If it's the quickest way to end this, THEN LET'S GO!" Negi shouted to his students, running out of the area they were previously in. All four left the Hall and ran back to the fork. Unfortunately, the fork that was there before was not the same. This time the corridor was facing completely different directions, and new signs were now inscribed on the walls.

The first one said,

"Enter there and you shall die,
Enter here and you shall fly.
Flying up in skies above,
floating upon clouds of love."

The second one said,

"Enter here and all shall flourish,
Enter and there and none shall nourish,
The power of ones will of mind,
The power here is pure you'll find."

"Gre~~at", Chisame said sarcastically. "They both say we'll die if we go in the other one."

"So which one, Negi-sensei?" Yue asked.

"Hmm...power of mind or love of the heart", Negi pondered to himself. Just then, Nodoka stepped forward.

"Umm...sensei. I think I know the answer", she said to her teacher as she walked a bit in front of him.

"Alright, Nodoka-san. Which way?" Negi asked his pupil, who continued forward to the wall and pushed the brick in between the two signs. Almost immediately a door-sized section of the wall parted, leaving the other three in the group looking slack jawed at Nodoka. She blushed as Negi asked, "How-how did you know to do that?!"

"Both heart and mind are needed to be a pure person, not one or the other", she answered with a smile.

"Way to go, Nodoka!" Yue cheered as she hugged her friend. Again the girl blushed.

"So what are we waiting for? Let's hurry this up! I haven't had much food today!" yelled Chisame. The four all began to sprint down the hallway and into the darkness. As they did a sudden light spread across all of them. However, Negi began to feel a tingling feeling similar to that of growing. He was then raised into the air as more and more rays of light focused on him. His body began to glow, and as soon as it began it stopped. He reached forward and touched Chisame's arm. Nothing happened. He poked her a couple of times more. Again, nothing happened.

"Alright!" Negi cheered as Yue and Nodoka hugged their teacher, happy that he was normal again. "The curse has been LIFTED!!" The four then all retraced their steps and found that the fork in the hallway was normal once again.

Once they were all outside of Library Island, Negi and his students all parted their individual ways. Some were leaving to go to sleep, some going to read, and some going on the Internet until four a.m. the next night. As for Negi himself, he returned to his dorm, said hello to Asuna and Konoka, and laid down on his bed like a tree falling down after being cut by a lumberjack.

"Rough day, Negi?" Asuna asked the exhausted boy.

"You have NO idea", Negi chuckled to himself.
13333112122121.title: Bippity Boppity BIG!

133332.content: Maybe it was Ayaka, the student body president of Negi's class?
133332.title: Ayaka?

1333321.content:
Ayaka Yukihiro was rich. Extraordinary rich. But there are some things you can't buy with money (or even Mastercard), and that's love. Ever since child teacher Negi came to her school, Ayaka has been adoring and admiring the 10 year-old teacher, much to the chagrin of Asuna, her longtime rival and on-and-off friend. Her being the student representative, though, means she gets to see Negi quite a bit. Though sometimes Ayaka wondered to herself: did she actually like Negi, or does he merely remind her of the little brother she never had (he died before birth)? Ayaka tries to not think of that often, but one thing she knew for sure: she wanted to make Negi (and in the process, herself) happy.

One Sunday morning Ayaka was walking around the school, admiring the beautiful gardens and feeling the cool summer wind blowing in her long, blonde hair. She gave a happy sigh as she stood there and felt the breeze, thankful for the one day a week where she didn't have to worry about homework or getting things prepared for class. Shortly into her walk, though, she saw a familiar person not too far from the school garden: it was Negi! He seemed to be making a circle in the dirt with a staff, placing a little pebble in the center. Ayaka had to know what was up.

So Ayaka walked...er, ran, up to Negi.

"Good morning, Negi-sensei!", she smiled as she came up to the boy, hugging him from his backside. "How are you?"

"I'm f-f-fine, Ayaka-san", Negi replied, feeling a little dizzy from the sudden impact and for Ayaka's chest pressing on his back. "Nice to see you, too."

"What are you up to, sensei?" Ayaka asked, letting the child teacher go from her grasp. "It looks like one of those 'magic circles' that conjures up demons from one of those horror movies."

"Oh, it's nothing like that", Negi assured his student. "But...I don't know if I can clearly tell you."

"Negi-sensei!", Ayaka pouted, placing her head next to his. "I'm the Class Rep", she continued, this time looking much happier, rubbing Negi's head with her right hand. "You can tell me anything. I promise I won't tell."

"Well, okay...", Negi said reluctantly, whispering to Ayaka in her left ear that he was creating a magic circle to make an object in the dirt grow.

"Wow!" Ayaka exclaimed, once again rubbing Negi's head. "You have a cute, childish side in addition to being mature and sophisticated. You're so great, Negi-sensei!"

"But it's the truth!", Negi whimpered. "I'll even show you. Just stand back."

Ayaka did what Negi was told. Regardless of whether or not he was telling the truth, she was happy to see the confident look he got on his face whenever he worked hard at something. Negi then proceeded to lift up his staff in front of him, and recant the magic works:

"Incresco Tantus!"

And with that, a blinding, light blue light came from his staff. However, the light bounced off a nearby tree, not only missing the pebble in the dirt, but it collided with a different target: Ayaka!

"OH NO!!" she and Negi screamed at the same time, worried by whatever circumstances had just happened. By the time the flash of light was gone, Negi saw a very big sight: a 30-foot tall Ayaka!

"Huh? Why is everything so tiny?" was Ayaka's first words after the growth finished. The newly born giantess then looked below her field of vision and saw a tiny boy where her teacher once was.

"Negi-sensei, you're so cuuuuute doll-sized!" Ayaka squealed in delight as she picked up her teacher and embrace him in her arms, his head resting on her new sized chest.

Uh-oh... thought Negi to himself, hoping no one saw him. Especially Asuna.
1333321.title: Ayaka's Bigger Horizon

choices: Ayaka and Asuna fight and attract somebody's attention
13333211.content:
"Neggggi-bozuuuuu!"

Negi winced at the sound of Asuna's voice. "Oh, no", he whimpered to himself as he heard Asuna continue to run towards him.

"Where are you- (gasp!)". Asuna froze in place as soon as she saw the giantess Ayaka hugging Negi in her arms. Her face then turned red, but not red from embarrassment: red with anger.

"What the heck are you up to, Negi?!" she yelled at her teahcer.

"Uh, I'm not up to anything Asuna-san!" Negi called down from the very tall Ayaka's chest.

"Then why is Class Rep so huge, huh?!" Asuna's face fumed with anger. "Why exactly are you two up to?"

"I-I was p-practicing a growth spell and I accidentally made Ayaka-san tall!" Negi shouted, attempting to defend himself. "It was an accident!"

"Oh, really? I told you you shouldn't be practicing growth spells! Frankly, I don't know why you're so interested in such crud! What, you didn't want to be short anymore or something?"

"You leave Negi-sensei alone!" Ayaka scolded her classmate, "He didn't want to do anything wrong! I asked him myself to do this, for your information. Besides, he's so cute when he's small." Ayaka then hugged Negi into her chest.

"What?!" Asuna shouted, "Hey! Stop that! You're gonna traumatize him, you pedophile!!"

"Pedophile?!" Ayaka yelled.

"Shhhh!! Please don't fight!" Negi pleaded. "If someone hears you they might get suspicious! And if they know I'm a mage in training, I'll get turned into an ermine!!"

"Negi's right", Asuna sighed, "We shouldn't yell...otherwise 'Sensei' might get in trouble."

"Wow, Asuna-san, that was actually very mature of you", a shocked Ayaka said to Asuna.

"Gee, thanks", replied Asuna with a sarcastic tone. As she looked up to give Ayaka a glare, she noticed she was glowing again, similar to when Ayaka grew the first time.

"Wait a minute...uh, Negi-sensei, is a tingly feeling a supposed side effect of your spell?" the worried Class Rep asked.

"Not sure", Negi answered, "Why do you ask?"

"I feel something at my feet", said Ayaka as her feet started to expand along with her legs. Her legs then started to grow, making the 30 foot tall Ayaka 30 feet taller.

"Negi-bozu! Stop that!" Asuna yelled.

"I'm not doing this!" Negi cried, "I swear!"

Ayaka's torso and arms then expanded to fit her legs, making Ayaka become 80 feet tall. Her head, however, did not grow and looked disproportionate on her huge body.
"Ha! Ha! Ha!" Asuna laughed at the surreal sight of Ayaka's head on her giant body.
Finally, Ayaka's head grew to make her a perfect 90 foot tall giantess.

"I'm gonna squish you for laughing at me!" threatened the 90 foot tall Ayaka as she proceeded to stomp her feet on the ground.

"I'd like to see you try!" Asuna remarked, positioning herself in a battle ready position.

"Girls, please! Let's not fight!" Negi shouted to his two students. "You'll attract attention!"
13333211.title: Pedophile!

133332112.content:
As angry as Asuna and Ayaka were at each other, Negi had a point: this kind of attention was not a good idea.

"I agree with Negi-sensei", Ayaka smiled to her teacher. "A beautiful flower like myself should not be tainted with such a tiny, dirty speck."

"Why you...!", Asuna fumed, clenching her hands into fists and looking ready to strike at any minute. But then she saw her teacher's worried face and soon unclenched them.

The three decided to get out of Mahora Academy at soon as possible. Under Negi's request, Ayaka grabbed hold of him and Asuna and put the two in her skirt pocket as the three made a dash away from the school.

"Where exactly ARE we going, Negi-sensei?" Ayaka asked, confused as to where she was going. She was simply running in a straight line away from the school.

"I'm not quite sure", a reluctant Negi told her. "I've never used an enlarging spell before."

"And you'll never be using it again, either", an annoyed Asuna told her teacher, rubbing her left hand fairly violently onto his hair. "This is why I can never leave you alone with magic, even for a second."

"You're just jealous because you wanted to be big, too", taunted Ayaka, giggling to herself. Asuna turned her head away from Negi, pretending not to care, and also blushing a little.

"Asuna-san, did you WANT to be big?" Negi asked his student.

"Of course not! What kind of a question is that?"

"But you turned red in the face just now and.."

"Enough, Negi! Sheesh, you don't have to analyze every single thing, you know. I'm already a decent height for a girl my age. There's no need for me to become some huge freak like Class Rep."

"Hey, watch it, Asuna-san! I can soon thrown you off of me as I can save you!"

"Oooh, I'm so scared", taunted Asuna, making a raspberry at Ayaka. She couldn't see it, mind you, but she knew she was given one.

"Enough, you two!" the worried Negi cried, swinging his arms left and right. "Ayaka-san, where are we?"

Ayaka then proceeded to stop and look around her environment. It seemed as if they ran into a temple none too far away from the school. It was old and torn-down, and it didn't look any bigger than a single floor, maybe two. The wood was old and discolored, and the flowers and shrubbery around it weren't doing too well, either.

"Negi-sensei, perhaps you can make this temple grow and we can hide here?" Ayaka suggested to Negi, taking him and Asuna out of her pocket and placing them back on the ground.

"I-I-I can try", Negi told his giantess student, trying his hardest not to look at her intimidating size in comparison to him. The boy then proceeded to take his staff and circle the whole shrine area, similar to how he made Ayaka grow. He then lifted the staff in his hands and began the incantation:

"Incresco Tantus!"

Negi, Asuna, and Ayaka watched as the shrine glowed a light blue color, not unlike the color Ayaka glowed when she started to grow. But how big does it grow?
133332112.title: Stop fighting!

choices: They search the tunnels for a trace of the Grimoire of ages.
1333321121.content:
The shrine grew slowly, brick by brick as it worked its way up into the sky until the giantess could just barely duck her head under its celling. As the three proceeded inside, Ayaka crouched down so as to hear her tiny companions and work out the next step of their plan.

"We should ask Evangeline if she knows how to reverse it", Asuna suggested.

"No, no. Evangeline-san might know something, but she would probably rather kill herself than tell us", Negi replied. Asuna and Ayaka both sighed at the same time only to find Negi's eyes alight with triumph.

"What is it, Negi-sensei?" Ayaka asked. "Is it good news?"

"Yes! Very good news! Do either of you know where we are?!" They both shook their heads. "This is the Hall of Catacombs!" Still ignorant as to what the good news is, Negi went on explaining. "This is the home to the one and only Grimoire of Ages. A book of spell so ancient and powerful it is said that casting one healing spell would heal every wound on every person in a 100 kilometer radius!"

"That is some impressive magic power", Asuna gasped.

"Right", Negi nodded. "And if we can get to that book.."


"Then it may have a spell to shrink me!" finished Ayaka.

"But where is it? This place wasn't exactly all that big before you grew it", Asuna stated.

"Asuna-san, it's called the Hall of Catacombs, and there are almost endless tunnels stretching under here. We just need to find a way to get to the caverns below us", Negi explained to his student. Just as he finished explaining, a large crashing noise almost cut him off. The two normal-sized people turned to see their giant friend up to her neck in the floor.

"She fell right through!" Negi yelled.

"Class Rep, are you ok?" Asuna asked.

"I'll be fine", she said, struggling a little to get free. Just then a large crack opened in the floor right under Negi and Asuna and they both fell right through it. Luckily Ayaka's hand moved swiftly enough to help her friends escape a narrow death.

"Well, what now?" Ayaka asked her teacher.
1333321121.title: 85 feet tall

choices: Negi wins! The trio head left
Asuna wins! The trio head right
13333211212.content:
Negi, Asuna, and Ayaka began to further travel down the tunnels (with Negi and Asuna traveling in their giantess friend's pant pocket), the latter being careful not to smash through any more floors as she walked like she had earlier that walk.

"In retrospect, I'm glad you made the shrine's ceiling so much bigger, Negi-sensei! I couldn't imagine crawling on my knees like a toddler the entire time", Ayaka thanked her teacher, smiling at the thought of him being in her pant pocket. "You really how the answer to every situation!"

"Aw, don't be so modest, Ayaka-san! You're my student. Of course I would help you out", Negi replied, gushing a little himself. Asuna just continued to stare into space as she tried to ignore Negi and Ayaka's chatting.

The walk seemed to take longer than she thought, though. Ayaka found herself traveling down a straight corridor for at least 10 minutes without so much as a single turn or sight to be seen. She found this to be quite strange. But that wasn't all; the ceiling seemed to be getting higher and higher! Ayaka found herself glowing once again, but feeling a different effect than from when she did before.

"Negi-sensei!! Something's happening to me!" the worried blonde began to whimper, watching as the more cramped friends of hers quickly got out of her pockets as fast as they could. It wasn't long before Ayaka found herself shrunk down to a mere 6 inches tall!

"Class Rep!" exclaimed Asuna, picking up the tiny Ayaka in a single hand. "Are you okay?"

"Yeah, I'm fine, but now I'm too small to be of any use...", Ayaka drooped in Negi's direction, feeling saddened by her recent development.

"Nonsense!" Negi smiled back. "You've done so much for us already, Ayaka-san! And I would be honored if you were to let me give you a ride in my pocket for your services." Asuna nodded in agreement as Negi reached out his hand to his little student, who climbed aboard it quickly. The giant Negi standing in front of her made her heart skip a beat. She was too happy for words to express the sight of what she was now seeing, and she continued to smile once Negi carefully put her in his left pant pocket.

"Comfortable in there, Ayaka-san?"

"Yep!! You're ready to go, Negi-sensei!!"

"Okay then. Let's go, Asuna-san!"

"Right! We better hurry before something else happens to Class Rep's inconsistent height."

That was something all three could agree on. The once giant shrine seemed to shrink by to its normal size as they kept running down the hall, though the trio's heights were unaffected during the whole process. Soon enough they came to their first set of tunnels in the Hall of Catacombs, wondering which way to go.

"Let's go right", Negi and Asuna said at the same time.

"No, let's go left!" a conflicted Ayaka suggested otherwise.

"Well...maybe the center sounds better..."

"No! Right"

"Left!"

"Right!"

"Left!"

The arguing continued until Asuna grabbed hold of Negi and scooped him in her arms.

"Stop! No more arguing! We'll determine this through rock-paper-scissors! Come on, Negi."

"You're right, Asuna-san. If we don't choose a path we'll never fix up Ayaka-san's height. If I win, we go left like she wants to. If you win, we'll go right."

"All right, Negi. Okay, then....GO!"
13333211212.title: Tunnel travelers

133332112121.content:
Negi's scissors beat Asuna's paper, so to the left the trio went. As they walked down the hall, though, they noticed the walls were caving in, and the ceiling was getting smaller and smaller. Before it was very high, but within a few hundred feet it was barely 6 feet above their heads. And in another 50 or so Asuna found herself barely able to stand up.

"It's no use, Negi! We're too big to continue much further! And it only gets smaller from here", Asuna grumbled at the near 5 foot ceiling.

"Hmm...I could probably still go through, though", Ayaka noted as she popped out of Negi's pocket. "Negi-sensei, put me on the floor."

Negi did what his student asked, scooping her up and gently placing her on the ground.

"I'll go on ahead on my own! You two stay here, okay?"

"Class Rep, no! It's too dangerous!" Asuna pleaded.

"I agree with Asuna-san!", Negi replied. "What if something happens to you!?"

"Negi-sensei, I'm not quite as weak as you think! Why, Asuna-san and I used to fight all the time, and until recently we were on even grounds! I'll be fine, I promise."

"No!" Negi yelled, grabbing Ayaka's skirt as she walked away. "One of us will go with you to help you!"

"But who?" Asuna asked.
133332112121.title: Cramped spaces

choices: She was, and she hugs them instantly upon contact
1333321121212.content:
"I'll go", Negi said as he held up his staff once more. He then concentrated on himself unless he was about two inches smaller than Ayaka. Asuna laughed a little when she watched her teacher comedically hold up his staff with two arms, then above his head, and then finally dropping it when it became too heavy for him to carry.

"Negi, be careful out there!" Asuna warned him, sounding like a mother to him. "You don't know what dangers there are, and now you don't have a staff!"

"We'll be fine, Ayaka-san! I don't need a staff to use all my magic", Negi assured his student as he bowed down to her. "We'll be back soon. Don't you worry."

"Negi..."

Asuna sighed as she watched both Negi and Ayaka walk off, their slowly getting smaller and smaller to her as they did. As for Negi and Ayaka; they eventually reached a very tiny room, barely an inch or two above Ayaka's head. It looked to be about a round square on all sides, and in the center was a tiny book, which looked small even to them. Ayaka picked it up, and carefully opened the book barely the size of her thumb.

"It says here that to find the way out of here, you must collect the purifying water from the other side", Ayaka read aloud to her teacher. "Negi-sensei, this is it! We can reverse this now!"

"Great job, Ayaka-san!" Negi chirped. Ayaka hugged her teacher instantly after he congratulated her, happy to hear those words coming from his mouth.

Negi and Ayaka sound ran out of the hall and back to where they were before, waiting for the sight of Asuna to put them at ease. But was she even there?
1333321121212.title: Asuna's very small teacher

1333322.content: Or maybe the athletic, energetic Makie?
1333322.title: Makie?

choices: Tell her the truth: Negi made her bigger
Make up a lie: tell Makie she's still asleep
13333221.content:
Makie Sasaki was as happy go lucky as could be, your typical energetic, cheerful teenage girl. She loved to gymnastics very much and spend much of her free time doing so, even at the result of her grades, which are among the worst in her class. But if there was one thing Makie liked more than gymnastics, it was arguably her teacher.

A while ago, Makie was training for a rhythmics contest, but overheard a fellow teacher that she was too childish and didn't take her training seriously. But Negi helped her out in her time of need, and soon she was filled with her energy and pizazz in her performances than she ever was before. Since that day she has taken a shine to Negi, and although not nearly to the same extent Ayaka or Nodoka did, liked him very much.

Our story takes us to the morning of Negi's growth preparations. Makie, going on a morning walk to build up her leg muscles, saw Negi during her walk and screeched to a hault, proceeding right towards the boy until she was right beside him.

"Good morning, Negi-kuuuun", smiled Makie. "How are you today?"

"I'm doing well, Makie-san", Negi smiled back. "Were you on a walk?"

"Yep", Makie smiled back. "But what's with the circle you made in the ground?"

Negi froze still when Makie asked him this. Unlike some of his other students, Makie didn't know that Negi used magic, and he certainly couldn't tell her, less he be turned into an ermine.

"Oh...this? I'm just playing in the dirt", Negi rushed, knowing full well that there was no way Makie would something that kind of crap.

"So you DO do kids stuff from time to time", she simply smiled at her teacher. "So what are you playing?"

"Well, I was "pretending" to make this pebble in this magic circle big..." Negi said before being interrupted, with Makie putting herself in the center of the circle.

"Neg-kun!" Makie smiled. "Could you make me "bigger"? *giggle*"

"Ummm......", Negi hesitated to reply.

"Come on, Negi-kun!" Makie frowned, proceeding to get puppy-dog eyes. "Pllllleeeaasssseeee?"

Negi thought once again of the consequences, but had a hard time resisting his student's puppy-dog eye look. He eventually caved in.

"Alright, Makie-san", Negi sighed. "But promise me you won't tell anyone about this."

"Got it", Makie nodded in reply. Negi then proceeded to lift up his staff vertically in his hands, facing in front of him, and proceeded to chant the incantation. As he chanted it the magic circle around Makie began to glow light blue, including Makie, and a light came from his staff.

"Incresco Tantus!!"

Shortly after, the light disappeared, as did the magic circle.

"Those were some nice lights, Negi-kun", Makie said in awe. "Where did they come from?"

"Umm...flashlights. That's it. Flashlights", Negi responded nervously.

"Oh, Negi-kun, you're so cu..." Makie felt a burning sensation in her stomach all of a sudden, falling to the ground.

"I feel dizzy..." Makie said in a daze, not noticing her increasingly larger body. First her legs grew, followed by her head, arms, hands, and finally her torso. At the end she stood up at a fairly tall height of 15 feet, about three times her normal size, a process that took about 3 minutes. Soon afterwards Makie proceeded to get up and saw Negi below, who barely came up to her skirt. Makie eyes opened wide, and Negi proceeded to cover his head for the fountain of tears that would no doubt come out. Instead, though, he was greeted with a

"YOU'RE SOOOO CUTEE!!" shouted Makie, hugging the much smaller Negi. "This has got to be a dream now!"

"Yeah. A dream, Makie-san", replied Negi, who fake laughed in reply. But what do I do with Makie-san now?
13333221.title: Big-time Makie

choices: Makie and Negi have a talk instead
133332211.content:
Lying was not of Negi's strong points. In fact, as a self-proclaimed gentleman he tried to avoid doing so as much as he possibly could. Negi then thought that if Makie should find out about his being a magician, he might be able to make a Pactio with her, if nothing else. After a few seconds of thought, Negi decided to tell Makie the truth.

"Makie-san, this isn't a dream!", Negi yelled lightly at the girl. "I'm really a magician and you grew as the result of a magic spell I recently learned!" Negi then thought that if there's a time his pink-haired student was going to cry, now would be the time she'd do it. However, much to his surprise STILL, Makie didn't see the slightest bit sad.

"Oh, Negi-kun, you're such a fibber", laughed Makie, proceeding once again to hug her teacher. "This is all just a dream, isn't it?" Negi sighed in relief at Makie's reaction: perhaps now he wouldn't get in trouble for this incident in the first place. But what do you when you triple the size of a teenage girl? She couldn't stay this tall forever, after all. What about school, and what would her friends think? And even if her friends DID think it was alright, they too might want to grow, and then OTHER girls would want to grow as well. And before you know it, Negi would be needing to use an elevator just to say "Hello" to his students, much less teach them.

"Hey Negi-kuuuun", smiled Makie. "Let's show Akira-chan this!" Negi once again proceeded to his worried state from before, but knowing full well Makie was going to do this whether or not he complied, simply went for the ride. But just before doing so, Makie felt a weird surge from her body. She noticed something odd about her hands as well..."

"Negi-kun, did my hands just get bigger?" asked Makie, showing Negi her hands, which had just grown several more inches in height in the last minute. Soon enough the rest of her body had continued to grow, beginning with her head, legs, arms, hands, and finally her stomach, chest, and bottom. Makie now stood at a height of about 30 feet tall. "COOL!" Makie screamed in delight. "Now I can definitely hold you on my shoulder, Negi-kun!" And as true to her word, Makie picked up her teacher with her hands and placed him on her right shoulder. "Ready to go meet her?" Negi shyly his head up and down in reply.

Now what should happen?
133332211.title: The truth will enlarge your student

choices: "I thought I did, but not anymore."
"You're right! I'll stay my current height."
1333322112.content:
Instead of going gung-ho about meeting her friend, Makie instead decided to stop, putting her teacher feet first back on the ground. She looked a little sad in her expression, and then she slowly sighed.

"What's wrong, Makie-san?" asked Negi. "You seemed so happy a minute ago."

"Oh, I am, sensei. It's so exciting and cute to see you the size of a doll. But I'm afraid of how Akira-can, and the rest of my friends, will react. I've watched so many television shows where there are girls who get bigger and freak out their best friends that I don't want the same thing happening to her."

"Makie-san, if you and Akira-san were good friends, you wouldn't worry about things like height", Negi replied. "Don't you agree?"

Makie then proceeded to look at Negi straight in the face by bending her knees and looking down at his eye level. "Well, Negi-kun..."
1333322112.title: Makie doesn't want to be big any more

choices: Makie returns to her normal height.
13333221121.content: "Please shrink me, Negi-kun!" cried Makie, sitting on the ground like she was in a big bed. "I don't want to be big if it freaks out my friends!" Negi agreed and proceeded to cast the spell. But what happens??
13333221121.title: Makie: downsized??

133332211211.content:
Despite using the same incantation to make Makie bigger, apparently it was this same spell that shrunk her back to normal size. The now normal sized Makie sighed in relief, now no longer worried about her childish appearance or short height anymore. She hugs her teacher in gratitude for returning her to her normal stature.

"What WOULD you have done if you decided to stay taller, Makie-san"? Negi asked her, but all Makie could do was smile.

"Well....I guess play with you, Negi-kun", giggled Makie. "It was a neat experiment, though. Tell me again if you want to make me shrink or something." With that, Makie ran off, and since no one noticed her growth, Negi didn't have to worry about the consequences of his magic using. Still, though, someone DID see him. Before Negi could even see it, he was bonked on a head by a taller person. That taller person was Asuna, who was watching the whole time.

"Don't use our classmates as guinea pigs for magic", she sighed, placing her left hand on Negi's bruised head, rubbing it. "Though I guess you found out it worked after all, huh?"

"Yep", Negi said in reply.

"Who knows? Maybe one day you can use it on me."

"Really, Asuna-san?"

"NO", Asuna sighed in response in a loud, annoyed tone. "Let's go get something to eat. I haven't eaten breakfast yet."

"Alright."

And with that, Negi and Asuna went back to the dorm. Negi decided he would never use the spell again, but perhaps he may be wrong..
133332211211.title: Back to normal.

133332211212.content: Unfortunately, the spell went awry, and Makie ended up being...
133332211212.title: Big or small..

1333322112121.content:
Unfortunately for Negi, the spell went awry, and Makie one again shot up in growth. Makie watched as her surroundings slowly became smaller and smaller, and she found it very hard to not move around, worried that she might hurt someone (or something) with her new, giant feet. The girl finally stopped growing at 50 feet tall, long since taller than the school building and most of the places around her. In fact, she was so tall now, Makie had to look down at her teacher just to see him.

"Makie-san, are you alright!?" Negi worringly asked her.

"I'm fine, Negi-kun, but I think hiding me is going to be quite a bit of a problem now...", the worried Makie whispered to her teacher, not wanting the student body overhear.

Of course, they DID overhear. And they definitely saw the 50-foot tall girl. Quickly and without hesitation, Makie grabbed her teacher, placed him in her skirt pocket, and began to ran like the dickens away from Mahora Academy. Neither one looked back as they continued to run..

(Sorry, no multiple choices for this branch yet)
1333322112121.title: 50-foot tall gymnist

choices: He accidentally shrinks Asuna and Konoka
He accidentally makes Makie even smaller
1333322112122.content:
At first, Makie was relieved to find herself shrinking. She slowly shrank back to the size she once was, and once she reached her normal height she hugged Negi in gratitude for returning to her normal stature. But Makie felt something weird...it felt as if her teacher was moving further apart from her. Eventually Makie realized that Negi wasn't moving...she herself was shrinking! First she was up to Negi's head, then his neck, and eventually she shrank to the point where she wasn't even up to his knees! Frightened by her new, small height, Makie did what any girl shrunk to the size of a big plush doll would do: panic. Actually, both Makie AND her teacher started to worry.

Fortunately for Negi, Asuna was actually watching him the entire time behind a tree, just in case someone was bound to happen. She popped out and surprised both Negi and Makie, the latter clinging to Negi's knee at height of the girl, who was tall as a building to Makie at her height. Instead of yelling at him, though, all Asuna could do was sigh. She then offered to help Negi restore Makie's current height, but something was off..

"My staff!" Negi exclaimed, noticing his bent wand, probably from the result of one of Makie's very big hugs. "I can't reactive the spell without it!" As Negi said this, his wand literally snapped in two. Upon its cracking, he bowed his head in apology to Makie.

"Well, we can't just leave her here", Asuna told Negi. "I guess we have to check Makie-chan to our dorm for the time being." Makie nodded in agreement at what Asuna said. She tugged on Negi's pant leg, hoping to get a ride on him. Surprisingly he agreed, and gently lifted Makie up and placed him on his shoulder. The three then went straight back to the dorm.

A FEW HOURS LATER

Negi had finally prepared his staff. Makie, who was on the bed asleep on Negi's bed, was then nudged by Negi to wake up.

"Makie-san, it's time to return you to normal size", Negi told his student, still half-asleep. He decided not to make a magic spell and started to chant the incantation...when suddenly Asuna and Konoka entered the room while he was performing his spell! Now what happens?
1333322112122.title: Small world, huh?

choices: He attempts yet again to make them big
He tries and fails, making them still tiny
13333221121221.content:
As Negi was about to prepare his spell, his aim of his staff was thrown off by Asuna and Konoka's arrival, and accidentally zaps them. Within seconds the two girls, both who used to stand well over their teacher's head, now had to, for the first time, LITERALLY look up to him. The two shrunken girls sat on the ground, dizzy.

"Oh no, Negi-kun!" cried Makie. "Now Asuna-chan and Konoka-chan have shrunk as well!" Negi was sweating profusely right now, thinking that, if nothing else, he would have made the girls simply taller. But now they less than a third his own height. Asuna and Konoka have now snapped out of the dizziness of the spell, and have noticed their much bigger surroundings.

Needless to say, Asuna was kind of scared. Her room looked like a warehouse at her new height, and the ladder that led to Negi's bed looked like a wooden skyscraper at her height. Her can of soda, to which she was drinking happily a minute ago, wasn't even big enough to carry with both her arms anymore. Although glad her clothes shrank with her, Asuna was fairly speechless. Konoka, on the other hand, thought it was cool and ran up to Negi's ladder and climbed up all the way up to his bed, admiring the fluffy, giant bed he had at her new height.

Just as Negi was about to try yet again to change them back, he got a phone call on his cell phone. It was Kotaro, and it seemed fairly urgent! Negi had no choice now but to leave the girls at their current height as he left to meet up with him.

"Don't worry, everyone", he told the girls, speaking in a much quiter voice than usual. "I promise to change you all back once I return." With that Negi ran out of the dorm and closed the door behind him. Little cries of "No!!" came as a result, but they were so faitn to Negi he couldn't hear them.

By this point Asuna was starting to feel a little more calm about her surroundings on Negi's bed, but still seemed sad. Konoka decided to talk to her.

"What's wrong, Asuna? Don't you think being as big as a plush toy is cool?"

"Not really, no...."

"But think of all the neat things you can do when small. Sodas seem like fountains, all-you-can-eat snacks, and beds as bouncy as trampolines. You should enjoy this moment, Asuna. Being with Negi-kun and his magic abilities is a special thin most don't get to share." And with that, Konoka jokingly shoved Asuna off her pillow, causing the girl to bounce repeatedly on her butt on Negi's bed. She was worried at first, but soon got on her legs and started jumping.

"You're right, Konoka. This IS fun." Asuna giggled and laughed as she jumped from one side of the bed to the next, hoping never to have to stop. "No chores, no homework, no newspaper route! THIS is what Sunday is all about." As the two happy campers continued to bounce, Makie looked outside the window from the top bunk. Wondering if she would ever return to normal...

So what should happen when Negi arrives back?
13333221121221.title: Three's company.

choices: Nope: just the four of them
133332211212212.content:
Negi came home later than night, around 7 p.m. By this point everyone was asleep, comfy on the bigger beds of their dormitory of their smaller height. This was soon interrupted when Negi came into the dorm, though, his steps on the ground giving off an almost earthquake-like effect to the three girls. Asuna, Konoka, and Makie all woek up in a flash.

"Negi / Negi-kun!" the three girls said to their teacher, a smile on all their faces. Perhaps he found a spell that could reverse the effect? Negi nodded his head in reply and once again proceeding to perform an incantation.

Unfortunately, it didn't work. Negi fell to his knees in sadness, proceeding to almost cry. Almost, that is, until Asuna stepped down from her bed and proceeding to meet Negi on the ground, eye-to-eye.

"Look, Negi, I'm sorry if I was made earlier, but I KNOW you can do this. Don't beat yourself up", Asuna told her teacher, with a depressed look on her face. "Let's all go eat dinner and get a good night's sleep. Tomorrow will be better. I promise." With that, Asuna gave her teacher a V for Victory sign, which cheered Negi up.

"Negi-kun, I have money for ordering out", Konoka told her teacher, also proceeding down from the bed to meet him at eye level. "What do you want?"

"Well..."

As Makie looked at Negi and co., she decided that as scary as being tiny was, she at least wasn't alone anymore.

"NEGI-KUUUN!" yelled Makie in a cheerful tone, proceeding to perform a backwards somersault from the highest bed.

"MAKIE-SAN!!" screamed Negi, trying his hardest to catch his tiny student. He needn't worry, though: Maike landed right on top of her teacher's head.

"Negi-kun, thanks for trying to help", she smiled, resting on his head. Negi then picked her and placed her on the ground with Asuna and Konoka.

"Sorry for being dramatic earlier", Makie said, apologizing to Asuna and Konoka.

"It's alright, Makie-chan. I was scared too when I first shrank", admitted Asuna.

"I think it's neat", smiled Konoka, causing Asuna and Makie to look at her with blank expressions.

"Negi-sensei, maybe we should go to the library tomorrow and find a solution", suggested Makie.

"That's a good idea", Negi replied. "Let's all four or us together."

"Yeah!!", the three girls shouted in unison. But where the four of them alone where they talked about this, or did someone else overhear them?
133332211212212.title: No good

choices: "I don't think it would be a good idea", said Asuna.
"Eh. On second thought, LET'S DO IT!" Asuna yelled.
1333322112122121.content:
It was 8:30 the next morning when the small girls awoke. They all stretched their tired muscles, passing "good morning" around throughout each other. Then Asuna came to a realization.

"Oh no!" she yelled. "Guys! Where's Negi?!" Makie let out a yelp of surprise as well and looked around for their missing teacher. Konoka, on the other-hand, merely smiled at her long-haired friend.

"It's Monday morning, Asuna. He's teaching", Konoka explained, watching Asuna's face creep into into an "Oh I get it!" expression.

"Well anyway..," Makie sighed. "What do you guys want to do? I mean, we have eight hours or so before he comes back. We can't just spend it all sleeping-in." The other girls nodded in aggreement.

"Well, what did you have in mind, Makie-chan?" Asuna asked thoughtfully.

"I was thinking we could go to class an-" Makie began to say before being interrupted by Asuna.

"WHAT!?" Asuna exclaimed, cutting her off in mid sentence. "Why would we waste a perfectly good day off to go to class!? I mean..God, Makie, you and I are Baka Rangers, right?"

"Asuna-san, please hear me out", Makie begged of her friend. "We should go to class, so we can..." A devilish grin passing over her face. "Mess with our class mates! Well, what do you think?"

"I think it would be fun to mess around with Set-chan! Let's do it!" Konoka chirped.

"I don't know. I mean, what if someone sees us or catches us?" Asuna asked.

"We don't have to do it if you don't want to, Asuna-san", Makie told her friend with a smile. "It was just an idea."
1333322112122121.title: Makie's Mischeviousness Manifests!

choices: Kazumi holds herself back, albeit barely
1333322112122122.content:
Meanwhile, not too far from their room, another girl at Mahora Academy had overheard Negi and his friends.

"Shrinking spell? Library?" the girl thought to herself. "What's THAT all about?"

The girl in question was none other than Kazumi Azakura, one of the biggest names in gossip at Mahora Academy. She had known about Negi's usage of magic for a while, but she was forced to hide it from others, less her teacher be turned into an ermine. Kazumi desperately held back the temptation to enter her teacher's dorm door, but found herself struggling in a losing battle. Does she fight the urge, or enter right there and now?
1333322112122122.title: Kazumi overhears

13333221121221221.content:
Negi, Makie, Asuna, and Konoka were planning their trip to the library when they received an unexpected visit from Kazumi Azakura, who had abruptly entered the room.
Kazumi took a snapshot of the four and everyone flinched from the flash.

"K-K-Kazumi-san!" Negi yelped. "Um... It's not what it looks like!".

"Really?" Kazumi started, "So, you mean to tell me that you are not planning to go the library and that three of your students aren't mini-sized?"

"Well... uh...", Negi began, but he didn't know what to say, so Asuna decided to speak for him.

"You're not gonna be telling everyone about this, are you?!" Asuna snarled.

"Uh, what?" asked Kazumi. "Oh, no, I'm not going to tell anyone. Although, this would probably the greatest story for the newspaper!".

Kazumi then took another picture.

"Ack! Stop doing that!" Asuna yelled as much her tiny voice could.

"Sorry," Kazumi apologized, "So, how did you all end up like this? It was Negi-kun's magic, wasn't it?"

"Ugh, yes..." Asuna groaned.

"Yeah," Makie answered, "First, Negi-kun accidentally made me grow very tall, and then he shrunk me. When he tried to grow me to normal size, Negi also shrunk Asuna-chan and Konoka-chan!"

"It's so much fun being small!" Konoka chirped.

"Is that so?" Kazumi ponders as she looked at her teacher with a wide grin.

"Do you mind if I try getting shrunk too, Negi-kun?" she asked with a big smile.

"What?! No! I can't!" said Negi. "I don't have a spell that could change you back-".

"Alright then...", said Kazumi as she held up a book. "I guess you won't be needing this book of magical spells Yue-san asked me to hold on to.".

"Book of spells?!" Makie shouts under her breath, "Negi-kun! We need that book!"

"But what if I can't find a spell that can change you back?" Negi asked.

"Forget it then!" Asuna barked at Negi, "We could still go to the library!"

"Or we could get changed back earlier!" Makie added.

"Well- I- we- uh..." Negi stammered as he soon Kazumi open back up the door. She was about to leave! He had to decide quickly!
13333221121221221.title: Kazumi enters

choices: The four wake up the next day the same size
The four wake up the next morning even smaller!
133332211212212211.content:
"Okay, I'll shrink you!" Negi said at the last moment before Kazumi left his dorm room.

"Great!" said Kazumi as she placed the magic book on Negi's bed. She then stood in front of the boy, her arms behind her back.

"This is going to be fun. Thank you, Negi-kun!"

"You're welcome..", he hesitated to say as he performed the spell.

Kazumi stood perfectly still as Negi worked his magic on the girl. Her head was the first part of her to shrink, but was soon followed up with the rest of ther body downwards until she was shrunk perfectly all around. Within moments she had shrunk to the exact same size as Asuna, Konoka, and Makie. Negi gathered them all four on the floor so they could talk to each other.

"Wow! This is great! Everything's so gigantic!" Kazumi said in awe.

"Yep!" added Konoka. "I think this is awesome too. Negi-kun looks like a colossus."

Kazumi stared at her "giant" teacher, noticing how tall he was in comparison to her. It was like she was looking at a gigantic statue. The rest of the room looked like a mansion in size to her, making even making Mahora Academy seem puny in comparison.

"I'm going to enjoy this!" chuckled Kazumi.

"Yeah, well it's getting late. We have to get some sleep", Asuna informed her friends as she pointed at the clock high above them.

"You're right. We need our sleep", Maki agreed with Asuna.

Negi also nodded in agreement with Asuna's reasoning. The four shrunken girls watched as their teacher scooped them all up and placed them on Konoka's bed. Asuna warned her teacher not to do anything funny to them while they slept, which he promised with all his heart to do so.

"Negi-kun wouldn't do that. He's the sweetest boy I've ever met", said Makie as she rested her head on Konoka's pillow and fell asleep. The other girls joined her soon after.
133332211212212211.title: Silencing the press by shrinking it!

13333221121222.content:
Negi proceeded to lift up his staff once again and recite the incantation. But he accidentally tripped himself from the noise Asuna and Konoka made when they entered the room and hit Makie off-balance! The 18 inch tall Makie then found her environment ever growing still, though her clothes were shrinking along with her. Negi watched as his student slowly shrunk down inch by inch at a rate of every 4 seconds or so every inch until a whole minute had passed. At that point Makie felt herself to be even tinier than she though possible before: she was now 3 inches tall! Negi even checked with a ruler to see his student's new smaller height and it also read 3 inches.

"Wow....", Makie said very quietly, looking petrified of her surroundings. "Everything's so....big. And scary."

"Makie-san, don't worry", the flustered Negi said trying to comfort her. "I'm sure we can work this out!" Meanwhile Asuna could only help but sigh to herself, and Konoka simply smiled at the cute, tinier Makie.

"I wish I could be that small", smiled Konoka.

"Are you SERIOUS!?" an annoyed Asuna asked her friend. "Being the size of an eraser doesn't sound like fun to me!"

"Well, Asuna-san, Konoka-san kinda has a point", Negi told his normal-sized students, pondering in thought. "Perhaps if one of you shrank, it would make Makie-san feel more used to be tiny."

"Ooh, pick me, Negi-kun!" Konoka giggled and smiled, mockingly waving her hand in the air like she was asking a question in class.

"Are you sure about this, Negi!?" whispered Asuna into Negi's left ear. "What if she shrinks to a height even smaller than Makie-chan?"

"Don't worry", Negi replied, whispering in Asuna's right ear. "Either way Makie-san will feel better. Then I can fix this problem tomorrow morning." Negi then proceeded to recant the incantation, and both he and Asuna saw the formerly 5 foot tall Konoka shrink slowly to barely 4 feet high, then 3 and a half, then about 2 feet 8 inches, 2 feet, 19 inches, all the way down to...
13333221121222.title: 3-inch tall Makie

choices: Ignore the note! Giant Mahora unleashed!
Listen to the note. Wait for Negi.
133332211212222.content:
Konoka opened her eyes slowly. Her gaze had been blurred slightly during the spell so it was hard focusing on a shape about twice her size. As soon as her vision cleared she saw Makie towering over her. Her eyes lit up and she embraced the taller girl from the waist down. Makie patted Konoka's head and crouched down to hug her back.

"Are you feeling any better, Makie-san?" Negi asked.

"Yes, much better. Thank you Konoka-san and Negi-kun", she said pulling away from Konoka's iron grip. Asuna reached down to pick the two of them up and then sat down on Konoka's bed. She put the miniature Makie on her lap but Konoka clung to her finger, hugging it as hard as she could.

"Konoka, let go!" Asuna said attempting to pry her roommate off of her finger. Even with her massive strength and size difference Konoka would not budge. Konoka, having had her fill of hugging Asuna, then turned to Negi. She jumped on his hand so fast he didn't have any time to react. Being a gentlemen, Negi hugged her back as best he could until she let go and plopped back onto Asuna's lap with the 3-inch Makie.

"Hahaha! This is fun right, Makie-chan? I want to be this small forever!" Konoka chirped.

"Konoka! Why would you say that?!" Asuna asked. "I mean what would Setsuna-san say if she found out about this? She would be really worried about you two."

"Yeah, I guess you're right", Konoka frowned in disappointed, only to lighten up again second later. "But I still think it's fun!"

"There is just no reaching you, is there?" Asuna sighed.

"And don't you forget it!" Konoka joked.

"Well, there's nothing to do now but go to sleep", Negi said, cutting Asuna off right before she could reply to Konoka. "Right", his three students said in reply.

"I'll go and get Makie-san checked into our room. Asuna-san, please watch them", Negi asked of her as he walked out the door to their room. "I'll be back in a second."

"Alright Negi. See ya", Asuna said.

"BYE NEGI-KUN!!" Konoka and Makie yelled in order for him to hear them. The door shut behind him and the two tiny girls looked up at their larger friend.

"Makie-chan, do you need a bath? Konoka and I have already taken one", Asuna asked her 3 inch tall friend.

"Yeah, I've been sweating all day. I'm all sticky", Makie said with a disgusted look. "But how am I going to take one? The other girls should be at the baths and I can't be seen like this!" The answer came when Asuna stood to with the two in her right hand and opened the door to the bath room with her left. She turned on the sink enough to accommodate Makie's size. A while later Makie was swimming in the sink completely alone with the door closed. The nob jiggled and Negi walked in. Seeing his student in the sink, he blushed ferociously and closed the door.

"Idiot Negi!" Makie heard Asuna yell at their teacher behind the closed door. "I told you Makie-chan was in there!"

"I didn't know that she was taking a bath!" he yelled back at her, blushing red. Asuna then lighlty hit Negi on the head, replying with "Well, what did you think she was doing?!" "I don't know. Ouch! Asuna-san, why'd you hit me?!" Their conversation continued in this manner for the next few minutes.

"I wonder if this is how they always are", Makie said to herself. She then got out using a tissue as a towel and put the clothes that Asuna had taken off one of her dolls. They fit snugly and she descended the sink carefully. When she finally hit the ground Asuna opened the door slightly.

"Makie-chan, are you done?" she asked the miniature gymnist.

"Yeah, I'm finished. Thank you", Makie smiled in reply as Asuna picked her up. For obvious reasons they all agreed that the smaller people would sleep in Asuna's bed. After exchanging "good nights", the group went to sleep. The next day Negi found both the smaller girls latched onto his hand. He looked around to see if he had wondered into Asuna's bed last night. Surprisingly, he hadn't.

"Hmm. Must have climbed up here while they slept," he said softly. He carefully detached them from his hand and laid them down. He then got up and dressed and ate. Afterwards he took a quick glance at the calender, which quickly stopped him in his tracks.

"Oh no!" he said in surprise at the day it said on the calendar. "It's Monday! Asuna-san, wake up! It's Monday! We have to go or we'll be late!"

"What are you talking about, Negi?" Asuna said groggily, rubbing her eyes. It was a rare day that the girl didn't have a newspaper route early in the morning, so she got to sleep in. "It's Monday! Get up, get up!" he urged his student, who finaly put two and two together and realized what day it was.

"Oh CRAP!" Asuna said as she rushed to get dressed and get her things together. "C'mon, Negi, let's go!" She turned to see her teacher writing something on a sheet of paper. "This is no time to write anything, Negi!" "I'm leaving a note for Makie-san and Konoka-san", He explained, folding the paper and putting it next to them on his bed. "Alright let's go." They then left for school at a high speed run.

A few minutes later the two other, noticeably smaller girls then woke up to find a note from their teacher next to them. With a little difficulty they unfolded the paper and read it.

"Konoka-san and Makie-san, Asuna and I have gone to school.
We will come and get you once it is over.
Please, for your sake stay here in the room.
Sincerely, Negi."

"Aww Ma~~~an! I want to explore at this size!" Konoka said in a disappointed tone. "Come on Makie-chan, let's go exploring!" But Makie was not as raring as her friend to do so, even if she was twice her size. "We shouldn't, Konoka-san. Negi-kun is looking out for us and we should listen to whatever he says. Still...it MIGHT be fun to look around. Oh, what to do?"
133332211212222.title: Hey, It's a Small World Out There.

choices: It's time for the four to get moving
1333322112122222.content:
After much thought, Konoka decided to agree with her friend that roaming around the school at this small a height was a bad idea. Still, though, the one and a half inch tall girl wasn't about to spend her day sleeping on Negi's giagntic bed, one that would put even most royal beds to shame at her new height. Makie too didn't want to spend all day cramped indoors herself.

"Now what do we do? School lasts for eight hours", Makie asked her friend, who then lit up in anticipation, as if she had just gotten an idea.

"I know, Makie-chan! Let's doodle!" the cheerful girl chirped as she slowly made her way down Negi's bed. Despite the intimidating size difference, Konoka wasn't the least bit scared as she made her way down Negi's bed, which was the equivalent of jumping off of a 60 foot tall building at her height. She used a wrapped-up blanket to work her way to the ground, using the pillow that Negi accidentally left on the ground from his sleep as a safety net on the ground below. Makie quickly followed her friend down the way.

Now that the process of getting to the ground was done, Konoka then proceeded to her school bag that she placed on the ground next to Negi's bed. The tiny girl had a hard time moving it around, but with some help from Makie they finally got it on the ground. The tiny Konoka then peeked around in the bag, which was kind of like exploring a cave to her, causing the girl to giggle happily to herself as she fished out her notebook. She then went in a second time to get some pencils. At the end, from start to finish, the process of getting the supplies out ate up the good end of an hour.

"Now what?" Makie asked her friend as she found a hard time lifting the usually tiny pencil in hr arms. "We're too tiny to write with these pencils!"

"That's why we have this", Konoka chirped in reply as she got out a bottle of ink roughly the size of Makie. "This is from my art class, but we can use it to draw."

"Sounds good", Makie nodded in reply, helping open up the notebook to a blank page and spewing some of the ink on the notebook page. The two then dipped their fingers in the ink and started drawing various things in it until they got sleepy once again around 2 p.m. or so. Makie drew herself winning golden trophy, her and an older Negi smiling together and almost kissing, and several other things. Konoka meanwhile drew herself with Setsuna, Asuna, and Negi, a picture of her as some magical girl, some animals, and a stylized version of her dorm room. A few hours later, Negi and Asuna finally came back, the latter going "Aw" at the sight of a tiny Konoka and Makie sleeping on her own notebook.

"Negi, do you really think we should wake them? They seem so peaceful", Asuna asked her teacher, but all he could was look stern in reply.

"Yes! We must wake them up! I must fix what I began!" Negi sternly replied to his student's question, sightly nudging the two tiny girls with his right pinky finger.
1333322112122222.title: Patience is a virtue

choices: "Evangeline. Maybe she knows something about shrinking magic."
"Takahata-sensei. He's got to know a way to fix this."
13333221121222221.content:
Makie was the first to stir, her tiny hands brushing Negi's pinky away. "Five more minutes", she said, unconsciously waving away another jab of his finger. Negi, as carefully as possible, picked the 3 inch girl up and shook her body just enough for her to open her eyes and see her teacher looking down at her. She stretched her tired muscles and looked up at Negi and Asuna.

"G' morning, Negi-kun!" she said with a large smile despite her small stature.

"It's not exactly morning anymore, Makie-san. But it's good you're up. We need you to wake up Konoka-san so we can get going", Negi said, smiling back.

"Alright, Negi-kun!" she said, nodding. She then turned to look at Asuna. "Hello Asuna-san!"

"Hi, Makie-chan". Asuna replied as the 3 inch tall girl strolled across the ink-stained notebook and shook Konoka gently.

"Konoka-san. Time to get up", Makie told her as Negi and Asuna debated on what to do first. Konoka began to open her eyes as Makie picked up her smaller friend. Makie smiled down at her as she stretched out and yawned in her arms.

"Hiya, Makie-chan", she chirped as Makie set her back down on the ground. Konoka looked around to see Asuna's hand ready to pick them both up. She then told her friends, "Come on, you two. We're going to see..."
13333221121222221.title: What to do? The road to recovery begins!

133332211212222211.content:
"Negi. I'm worried", Asuna said as she and her teacher walked along the pathway to Evangeline's cabin. "I know that Eva-chan is this great mage and all, but she's also an evil vampire. She might try to eat Makie-chan and Konoka." She then looking down at her tiny friends stationed comfortably in her pocket.

"She is our best bet, Asuna-san. Takamichi is a skilled mage, but Master knows more. She also has a vast library in the resort, though she may not let us in. I do see your point, though. She can be rather malicious."

The two of them reached the house and knocked on the door. They were soon answered by Chachamaru, Evangeline's robot servant and magical partner.

"Good afternoon, Negi-sensei", She said blandly. "Are you here for training?"

"No, Chachamaru-san. We have a problem and we need master's help", Negi explained to the robot girl.

"Oh, I see. Alright. Right this way. Master should be in her resort right about now." Chachamaru led the two to the little glass orb that had the words 'Evangeline's Resort' inscribed on it.

"Thank you Chachamaru-san", Asuna said as she, Negi, Konoka, and Makie (who was rather scared ,considering this was her first time entering the villa) were teleported inside. Once they all arrived (including Chachamaru), Asuna took the smaller girls out of her pocket and placed them on one of the bells on her head.

"So that's the problem?" Chachamaru asked inquisitively. "Master can fix that easily."

"Really?!" both her tiny classmates asked in anticipation. When Chachamaru nodded, they began to excitedly ring the bells in Asuna's hair, causing the red headed girl to take both of them off and place them on her shoulder.

"Aww Asuna~~~...put us back. We wanna play with your bells again", Konoka and Makie whined simultaneously.

"No! It's really annoying! Now come on, we have to find Eva-chan", she said as she glaring at them. They soon found Evangeline lounging around th beach area, with one of Chachamaru's sisters massaging her.

"Master, Master! We have a problem", Negi yelled from afar. He began to run along with Chachamaru and Asuna.

"What is it now, boy?" she said, looking up from her book to see him stopping in front of the massage table. She looked at Negi for a while before turning to Asuna. She saw the two shrunken girls on her right shoulder and began to laugh. "Ahahaha! That is hilarious! Y-you actually made two of your students tiny! It's like you're TRYING to become an ermine!"

"Master, please. We need to get these two back to normal", Negi pleaded to Evangeline.

"Ahaha..fine. Come into the library. I won't fix this for you since I find it incredibly funny, but you should be able to find a way to fix it yourself in here", she told Negi, calming down a bit. The child teacher then proceeds inside the library and grabs the nearest book. He flips through the pages as Asuna sits with the girls in her lap.

"Wait a second...these are all dark spells", Negi realized.

"Yeah. What of it? My specialties ARE dark and ice", Evangeline said. "You're just using the spell to grow your students, right? Besides, if you really ARE my pupil, you should be able to embrace the power of darkness like I do."

Negi was beginning to have second thoughts about whether or not to listen to his master's advice. After thinking it over he finally decided to...
133332211212222211.title: Evangeline to the rescue

1333322112122222111.content:
"I-I-I'll do it. I'll embrace darkness", Negi said hesitantly. "If it is thee asiest way to settle this whole mess then I'll dot it."

"No one ever said it would be easy, but it probably is the fastest way to fix. That's all I'll say about it," Evangeline said lazily as she strolled out of the large room.

Around an hour and a half later, a very tired Negi emerged from the large library doors, being greeted a second later by Asuna and the two smaller girls who had left Negi, upon request, to study alone.

"S-ss-so, did you find the spell to fix this?" Asuna asked Negi with concern. A small nod from her teacher made Asuna and the other two girls sigh in relief.

"Good, I'm kinda done with worrying about these two for a while."

Negi nodded in agreement as Asuna placed the girls on the ground in front of him. This time, not even bothering to draw a circle around them, he then began to chant a strange spell. Each word quaked within the smaller girls as they felt a sensation they couldn't explain. Their bodies started to glow an eerie black. And in a burst of released energy they found themselves back to normal.

"NEGI-KUN!!!! You did it!!" all three girls exclaimed as they looked at their teacher. Or rather the place that he was formally standing.

"Negi? Where'd you go?" Asuna asked, puzzled. She felt a slight tap on her heel and looked down to find her one inch tall teacher looking up at her. She stiffened as what she saw caught up with her.

"N-N-Negi!? What happened?!" she panicked as she picked up her teacher.

"I don't know. It didn't say anything about this in the book", he replied, trying to keep himself level headed.

"Isn't it obvious!?" Evangeline shouted. "You chose a spell in which you had to give up something of your own in order to give it to someone else."

"KKKYYAAAHHH!!!" Konoka screamed as she snatched Negi away from Asuna. "Negi-kun!! You're sooooooooo cute!"

"Konoka-san, please stop!" Negi yelled as Konoka hugged him multiple times.

"Eva-chan, how do we fix this??" Asuna asked, taking Negi back from Konoka's iron grip.
1333322112122222111.title: The darkness that flows through us...

choices: One of the girls sacrifices her height
13333221121222221111.content:
"You'll have to use another spell to return shrimpy there back to normal", Evangeline explained to Asuna, Konoka, and Makie.

"Too bad my healing powers can't make people grow..", Konoka fake sighed as she continued to press Negi against her face, in reality enjoying her shrunken teacher.

"Konoka, leave Negi-kun alone! Besides, I want to hold him now", Makie yelled at her friend, grabbing hold of the small teacher and placing him in her hands. "Kyaaaaaa! So cute!"

Asuna, paying no need to her friends' affection for the bug-sized teacher, proceeded to flip through some more books to find a reversal spell. Indeed she did...but like the last spell, it would come at a price of height.
